name: Gardens of Golden Gate Park
description: Golden Gate Park's gardens include the Conservatory of Flowers (a Victorian greenhouse with tropical plants), Japanese Tea Garden (the oldest public Japanese garden in the US), and San Francisco Botanical Garden (featuring 9,000 plant species from around the world).
fullDescription: Golden Gate Park's gardens include the Conservatory of Flowers (a Victorian greenhouse with tropical plants), Japanese Tea Garden (the oldest public Japanese garden in the US), and San Francisco Botanical Garden (featuring 9,000 plant species from around the world).
whatTheyOffer:
- SF Residents: Free admission to Botanical Garden with ID
- Veterans/Active Military: Free admission with ID
- Museums for All: Reduced admission with EBT card
- Free hours: Early morning entry at select gardens
- Children under 5: Free at all gardens
- Regular admission varies by garden ($10-15 adults)
howToGetIt: Show SF proof of residency, military ID, or EBT card at the entrance. Visit early mornings for free admission hours at certain gardens. Check individual garden websites for current free hours and policies.
keywords: Golden Gate Park gardens, Conservatory of Flowers, Japanese Tea Garden, Botanical Garden, SF resident free, veteran free
